definition: bull market (prices appear to be rising)
to look after/to take care of/to watch/to guard
to see/to look at/to read/to watch/to visit/to call on/to consider/to regard as/to look after/to treat (an illness)/to depend on/to feel (that)/(after verb) to give it a try/Watch out! (for a danger)

sentences.english: The overall technical backdrop remains bullish and favors another attempt to rally toward recent high.
sentences.chinese: 總體技術面仍看漲，支持再次向近期高點上攻。

sentences.english: A catch-up is imminent, say the bulls.
sentences.chinese: 看漲者認爲，股市不久將奮起直追。

sentences.english: That bullish close signals a new uptrend and long entry.
sentences.chinese: 看漲行情結束標誌一個新的上升趨勢和買入點的出現。

sentences.english: KDJ index low to form gold forks, late call is more likely.
sentences.chinese: KDJ指標在低位形成金叉，後期看漲的可能性更大。

sentences.english: The overall technical backdrop however, remains bullish. So, buying on market dips should be rewarding.
sentences.chinese: 不過總體技術面仍看漲，因此逢低買進應是上策。

sentences.english: Only a cross-over above the zero line of the indicator could signal bullishness again.
sentences.chinese: 只有在零線指標之上的交叉可能預示又一次看漲。

sentences.english: The more people invest in stocks, the higher the stock prices rise.
sentences.chinese: 買進的人多了，股票行情就看漲。

sentences.english: Real estate is well up, and I could afford you a pretty handsome price.
sentences.chinese: 不動產大大看漲，我可以給你個好價錢。

sentences.english: The market opened in a bullish mood.
We are fully aware of the rising tendency of this product in the world market.
sentences.chinese: 我們很清楚，這種產品在世界市場上的行情看漲。

sentences.english: The amateur buys calls and sits back to watch his money double.
sentences.chinese: 業餘選手可以買看漲期權，並坐等自己的資金翻番。

sentences.english: Note that a look-ahead at the indicator shows that the oversold indicator may flip to bullish in the near-term.
sentences.chinese: 注意這個指標的前瞻顯示賣空指標可能在近期看漲。

sentences.english: The goods is in short supply, consequently the market will probably rise next week.
sentences.chinese: 這種貨物供應不足，因此下週市場行情可能看漲。

sentences.english: Ret market continue bullish no chance to get same rate presently.
sentences.chinese: 海運市場持續看漲，目前無法獲昨相同動費率。

sentences.english: The bullishness is spreading like wildfire within China, too.
sentences.chinese: 看漲的想法如同野火般也正在中國蔓延。

sentences.english: Hammered by the plasticizer scandal, natural fruit juice becomes extremely popular, and the price of fruits continues to rise.
sentences.chinese: 受到塑化劑影響，天然果汁夯，水果價格也持續看漲。

definition: the tide rises, the boat floats (idiom); fig. to change with the overall trend/to develop according to the situation
long-term/at a fixed date in the future (e.g. for repayment)/abbr. for 遠期合約|远期合约[yuan3 qi1 he2 yue1]
hook (on which to hang sth)/to couple/to link together/to establish contact with/hook/coupling links (e.g. between two railway coaches)
hot money, money flowing from one currency to another in the hope of quick profit
